paper.title: CCS and Petri Nets
paper.venue: Proceedings of the LITP spring school on theoretical computer science on Semantics of systems of concurrent processes
paper.abstract: In the usual semantics of CCS-like languages, parallelism is reduced to non-deterministic interleaving of actions. As an alternative semantic model for CCS with a clear distinction between concurrency and nondeterminism, Petri nets may be used. This paper gives an introduction to Petri net semantics for CCS. Two approaches are considered: a compositional approach where semantic operations are defined for Petri nets explicitly, and an operational approach using Plotkin-style transition rules which is particularly convenient for infinite processes. It is discussed which class of CCS programs is representable by finite nets.
